title: Panel, early 17th century
medium:
Medium: silk, metal-wrapped silk, and metal embroidery on silk foundation
Technique: embroidered in satin, chain, knot, stem, and couching stitches on 7&1 satin foundation
description: Small embroidered panel with two scenes from the Labors of Hercules: in the lower left corner, Hercules with the three-headed dog, and in the lower right corner, Hercules wrestling with a lion.  A monkey sits between these two scenes, while a deer, a warthog, and a dog fill the background.  Framed by a curving border of berries. Embroidered in gold metallic threads and polychrome silks on an ivory silk foundation.

tombstone.epitaph:
Panel, early 17th century.
early 17th century. Medium: silk, metal-wrapped silk, and metal embroidery on silk foundation
Technique: embroidered in satin, chain, knot, stem, and couching stitches on 7&1 satin foundation. Bequest of Gertrude M. Oppenheimer. 1981-28-124.
